mainEntity.name: Can I only run Ethereum nodes with this?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, NiceNode only supports Ethereum node software, and at the moment, geth node client is only supported.

mainEntity.name: Do I need 32 ETH to run a node?

acceptedAnswer.text: You don‚Äôt need 32 ETH to run a node. As long as you have the hardware that fulfills the minimum requirements, you‚Äôre able to run your own full node at home!

mainEntity.name: What types of nodes do you support?

acceptedAnswer.text:
NiceNode currently supports full (snap sync mode by default) and light nodes. Archive node is planned to be supported in the future.

Read more about the different types of nodes here

mainEntity.name: I don‚Äôt meet the requirements to run my own node. What can I do?

acceptedAnswer.text: Even if you don‚Äôt meet the requirements, you might be able to run your own light node with NiceNode! However, because it is still an experimental feature, please only try it with funds you are willing to lose.

mainEntity.name: How long will it take to sync my node?

acceptedAnswer.text: Full node may take a few days to sync, depending on your bandwidth and hardware, and a light node may take a few minutes to fully sync.

mainEntity.name: Can I use MetaMask with NiceNode light mode?

acceptedAnswer.text: Light client mode is an experimental feature. Only use funds that you are willing to lose. Please read Geth's light client guide before using!

mainEntity.name: How can I use MetaMask with NiceNode?

acceptedAnswer.text: First, your node must be fully synced. Second, enable MetaMask connections from NiceNode <>> Settings > ‚ÄúEnable MetaMask Connections‚Äù. Third, in MetaMask > Add Network and enter ‚ÄúNiceNode localhost‚Äù with RPC URL ‚Äúhttp://localhost:8545‚Äù. If your node is running and fully sycned, the Chain ID and other fields will be completed by MetaMask automatically and now click Save. For official info from MetaMask, follow MetaMask's local node guide

mainEntity.name: Are there any plans to support consensus layer nodes? What other nodes will you support?

acceptedAnswer.text:
Yes, consensus/beacon nodes will be implemented next, however, validation/staking has not been decided on yet. There will need to be extensive auditing before committing to doing so. Layer 2 nodes will also be supported eventually!
